data.title: UIRichText word wrapping cuts words instead of spaces
data.body:
For example, the string:

```
Restores 5,000 HP to all targets every 3 turns.
```

will be wrapped like this, given the width is small enough:

```
Restores 5,000 HP to all tar
gets every 3 turns.
```

The word "target" should not be cut in the middle. It should be sent to the next line instead:

```
Restores 5,000 HP to all
targets every 3 turns.
```

data.title: Fix PUParticle Bug
data.body: The movement of particle lags one frame.

data.title: [cocos2dx-js]ccs  Listview's clipping function has bug
data.body: When ListView has any ClippingNode children, the ListView's clipping function will not work!

data.title: problem in CCNode.cpp
PhysicsBody behaves like convulsion after 3.6
data.body:
Hi, I found a bug,that physics body behaves wrongly when a physics body overlapped the other physics body.PhysicsBody behaves like convulsion.

This bug is confirmable on cpp-test [Node:Physics].
・Pyramid Stack
・Slice

I confirmed this bug on following conditions.
・iPhone6
・iOS9.1
・Cocos2d-x 3.6( ~ 3.9beta0)

I observed this bug doesn't occur on following conditions.
・iPhone6
・iOS9.1
・Cocos2d-x 3.5

So I use version 3.5 on developing game using physics engine.

data.title: No sound on mac os x app when using precompiled libs
[Web engine] Removed node may still be hold by actions and cause memory leak
data.body:
A developer reported that when removing a node from the scene, if it has some actions attached, the action will cause the node still reachable from ActionManager, then it won't be collected by GC.

In the engine logic, normally, when a node detached from the scene, the cleanup should be called recursively from itself to its children node tree. The cleanup function is in charge of stopping actions and remove it from the action manager. If user report is right, it means there is something wrong in the detaching process.

Our logic need to be reviewed and check whether the problem exist.

data.title: OpenGL state bug on render queue
data.body:
In the following case,
1. 2D Sprite can rotate along x, y axis.
2. 2D user may draw their custom triangles at a wrong order.
It will get wrong results if some one turn on the cull face, for example 3D Sprite, Skybox camera brush. 

So it is better to have the cull face of 2D queue turned off explicitly, and turn on it for 3D queue.

data.title: [ci skip]Web engine important issue fix
data.body: https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-html5/pull/3179

data.title: fix cull face for render queue
data.body: 2D render queue should disable cull face.

data.title: Fix resolution in TransitionCrossFade
data.body:
TransitionCrossFade has some resolution issues that can, in some situations, result in a pixelated image during the transition.

I described the issue some time ago in https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/8634 and posted a possible workaround - the code in this PR is cleaner and should work on all platforms.

data.title: Can not get binary data from file in a lua project?
data.body:
I'm using Cocos2d-x v3.8 and create a lua project.
When trying to reading a binary file , *.mo file actually, I found that there are no binding of `getDataFromFile` nor `getFileData` via

``` lua
getmetatable( cc.FileUtils:getInstance() )
```

The call of `cc.Helper` and `cc.HelperFunc` also return `nil`.
I've also tried to use native `io.open` and wrapped `io.readfile` , but no way to get full path of a file from relative path in cocos, because `cc.FileUtils:getInstance():fullPathFromRelativeFilename(file_name)` only returns path which only relative to project, not 'full' path actually.

So, is there any way to read binary file in a lua project?

data.title: easy jni
data.body:
This commit adds variadic template wrappers for JNI calls. Full description is available in the following forum post: http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/easy-jni-with-variadic-templates/24740

Tests are added as well.
